2026-01 CHI event
  • Home

On this page

  • GenLM
  • ChiMind

Reading List

GenLM

  • Lew et al. (2023, The LLaMPPL paper)
  • Loula et al. (2025, Paper introducing what is now genlm-control)
  • Lipkin et al. (2025, AWRS)
  • Vieira et al. (2025)
  • Lew et al. (2022, RAVI)

ChiMind

  • Wong et al. (2023, Introduces RMC (rational meaning construction) framework)
  • Wong et al. (2025, Introduces MSA (Model Synthesis Architectures))
  • Ahmed et al. (2025, Introduces TheoryCoder, a theory-based reinforcement learning (TBRL) system.)
  • Ahmed et al. (n.d., Introduces the TheoryCoder-2 TBRL system.)
  • Tsividis et al. (2021, EMPA TBRL system.)
  • Ying, Truong, et al. (2025, Introduces LIRAS – an MSA-like architeecture for modeling social reasoning.)
  • Ying, Collins, et al. (2025, World model induction for novel games.)
  • Collins et al. (2025, “Intuitive Gamer” model of novice gameplay.)

References

Ahmed, Z.,..., & Gershman, S. J. (n.d.). Learning abstractions for hierarchical planning in program-synthesis agents. Submitted to OpenReview. https://openreview.net/forum?id=DwLrBBZfDl
Ahmed, Z., Tenenbaum, J. B., Bates, C., & Gershman, S. J. (2025). Synthesizing world models for bilevel planning. Transactions on Machine Learning Research. https://openreview.net/forum?id=m9V4JHLJrD
Collins, K. M., Zhang, C. E., Wong, L., Costa, M. B. da, Todd, G., Weller, A., Cheyette, S. J., Griffiths, T. L., & Tenenbaum, J. B. (2025, October 13). People use fast, flat goal-directed simulation to reason about novel problems. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2510.11503
Lew, A. K., Cusumano-Towner, M., & Mansinghka, V. K. (2022). Recursive Monte Carlo and variational inference with auxiliary variables. In J. Cussens & K. Zhang (Eds.), Proceedings of the thirty-eighth conference on uncertainty in artificial intelligence (Vol. 180, pp. 1096–1106). PMLR. https://proceedings.mlr.press/v180/lew22a.html
Lew, A. K., Zhi-Xuan, T., Grand, G., & Mansinghka, V. K. (2023). Sequential monte carlo steering of large language models using probabilistic programs. https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.03081
Lipkin, B., LeBrun, B., Vigly, J. H., Loula, J., MacIver, D. R., Du, L., Eisner, J., Cotterell, R., Mansinghka, V., O’Donnell, T. J., Lew, A. K., & Vieira, T. (2025). Fast controlled generation from language models with adaptive weighted rejection sampling. Second Conference on Language Modeling. https://openreview.net/forum?id=3BmPSFAdq3
Loula, J., LeBrun, B., Du, L., Lipkin, B., Pasti, C., Grand, G., Liu, T., Emara, Y., Freedman, M., Eisner, J., Cotterell, R., Mansinghka, V., Lew, A. K., Vieira, T., & O’Donnell, T. J. (2025). Syntactic and semantic control of large language models via sequential monte carlo. The Thirteenth International Conference on Learning Representations. https://openreview.net/forum?id=xoXn62FzD0
Tsividis, P. A., Loula, J., Burga, J., Foss, N., Campero, A., Pouncy, T., Gershman, S. J., & Tenenbaum, J. B. (2021, July 27). Human-level reinforcement learning through theory-based modeling, exploration, and planning. http://arxiv.org/abs/2107.12544
Vieira, T., Lebrun, B., Giulianelli, M., Gastaldi, J. L., Dusell, B., Terilla, J., O’Donnell, T. J., & Cotterell, R. (2025). From language models over tokens to language models over characters. In A. Singh, M. Fazel, D. Hsu, S. Lacoste-Julien, F. Berkenkamp, T. Maharaj, K. Wagstaff, & J. Zhu (Eds.), Proceedings of the 42nd international conference on machine learning (Vol. 267, pp. 61391–61412). PMLR. https://proceedings.mlr.press/v267/vieira25a.html
Wong, L., Collins, K. M., Ying, L., Zhang, C. E., Weller, A., Gerstenberg, T., O’Donnell, T., Lew, A. K., Andreas, J. D., Tenenbaum, J. B., & Brooke-Wilson, T. (2025). Modeling open-world cognition as on-demand synthesis of probabilistic models. https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.12547
Wong, L., Grand, G., Lew, A. K., Goodman, N. D., Mansinghka, V. K., Andreas, J., & Tenenbaum, J. B. (2023). From word models to world models: Translating from natural language to the probabilistic language of thought. https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.12672
Ying, L., Collins, K. M., Sharma, P., Colas, C., Zhao, K. I., Weller, A., Tavares, Z., Isola, P., Gershman, S. J., Andreas, J., Griffiths, T. L., Chollet, F., Allen, K. R., & Tenenbaum, J. B. (2025, November 22). Assessing adaptive world models in machines with novel games. NeurIPS 2025 Workshop on Bridging Language, Agent, and World Models for Reasoning and Planning. https://openreview.net/forum?id=2EdUKZaq6z
Ying, L., Truong, R., Collins, K. M., Zhang, C. E., Wei, M., BrookeWilson, T., Zhi-Xuan, T., Wong, L., & Tenenbaum, J. B. (2025). Language-informed synthesis of rational agent models for grounded theory-of-mind reasoning on-the-fly. In C. Christodoulopoulos, T. Chakraborty, C. Rose, & V. Peng (Eds.), Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics: EMNLP 2025 (pp. 12217–12235). Association for Computational Linguistics. https://doi.org/10.18653/v1/2025.findings-emnlp.654
